definitions.definition: The ability of the brain to record information or impressions with the facility of recalling them later, usually at will .
examples: Memory is a facility common to all animals.

definitions.definition: A record of a thing or an event stored and available for later use by the organism.
examples: I have no memory of that event.
My wedding is one of my happiest memories .

definitions.definition: The part of a computer that stores variable executable code or data ( RAM ) or unalterable executable code or default data ( ROM ).
examples: This data passes from the CPU to the memory .

definitions.definition: The time within which past events can be or are remembered.
Which returns to its original shape when heated
Synonym of pelmanism ( “ memory card game ” ) .
A term of venery for a social group of elephants , normally called a herd .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The ability of the brain to record information or impressions with the facility of recalling them later, usually at will .
secondary_definitions: A record of a thing or an event stored and available for later use by the organism.
( computing ) The part of a computer that stores variable executable code or data ( RAM ) or unalterable executable code or default data ( ROM ).
The time within which past events can be or are remembered.
( attributive , of a material ) Which returns to its original shape when heated
Synonym of pelmanism ( “ memory card game ” ) .
( zoology , collective , rare ) A term of venery for a social group of elephants , normally called a herd .
